snippet: Science Applications International Corporation agreed to pay $370 million in restitution and $130 million in a penalty for its role in what prosecutors called one of the "most brazen frauds ever committed against the City of New York."
abstract: Science Applications International Corporation agreed to pay $370 million in restitution and $130 million in a penalty for its role in what prosecutors called one of the "most brazen frauds ever committed against the City of New York."

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and COLIN MOYNIHAN

headline.main: Company in CityTime Payroll Scandal to Pay $500 Million
